snippet: The United States economy added a disappointing 120,000 jobs in March, the Labor Department reported on Friday, about half the gains posted in each of the preceding three months.
abstract: Labor Department reports that unemployment rate rose to 8.3 percent in March, from 8.2 percent in February, as a smaller portion of the population sought work; report shows that employers added 120,000 jobs, about half the net gains posted in each of the preceding three months; conservative politicians, including Mitt Romney, seize on data as political ammunition against Pres Obama.

byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The United States economy added a disappointing 120,000 jobs in March, the Labor Department reported on Friday, about half the gains posted in each of the preceding three months.

headline.seo: March Jobs Report Shows Disappointing Growth
headline.main: After a Winter of Strong Gains, Job Growth Ebbs
headline.print_headline: After A Winter Of Strong Gains, Job Growth Ebbs
